intro: Blepharis sol, commonly known as the desert star, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its small, star-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has slender, branching stems and narrow, grass-like leaves that help reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Blepharis sol is a hardy, drought-tolerant species that plays an important role in stabilizing desert ecosystems.
